definitions.definition: the act of protecting somebody/something; the state of being protected
definitions.sensetop: protection against somethingprotection from somethingprotection of somebody/something (against/from something)protection for somebody/something (against/from something)for protectionunder protectionunder the protection of somebody/something

examples.text: Wear clothes that **provide** adequate **protection** against the wind and rain.
His straw hat **offered** some **protection** from the sun.
We seek to ensure the protection of human rights.
the conservation and protection of the environment
They are campaigning for better protection for workers.
She carries a gun in her bag for personal protection.
He asked to be put under police protection.
These people remain under the protection of the United Nations.
**data protection** laws
the importance of **environmental protection**
A helmet affords the cyclist some degree of protection against injury.
Animal protection supporters gathered to protest against hunting.
Fire protection equipment must be available on all floors.
Governments must provide protection for their workers.
Many British wild animals are now under the protection of the Wildlife and Countryside Act.
She was put into a psychiatric hospital for her own protection.
The couple were found guilty of violation of child protection laws.
The high walls give the garden protection from the wind.
The site is under the protection of UNESCO.
The skunk releases a pungent smell as a means of protection.
a witness-protection program
sun protection products

definitions.definition: a thing that protects somebody/something against something
definitions.sensetop: protection against somethingprotection from somethingas (a) protectionas (a) protection against/from something

examples.text: The plastic sheeting is not a complete protection against the rain.
The trench served as a protection from enemy gunfire.
He wears a helmet as protection.
Fill the cooling system with antifreeze as a protection against frost.
They wore the charm as a protection against evil spirits.

definitions.definition: insurance against fire, injury, damage, etc.

examples.text: Our policy offers complete protection against fire and theft.

definitions.definition: the system of helping an industry in your own country by taxing foreign goods

examples.text: The government is ready to introduce protection for the car industry.

definitions.definition: the system of paying criminals so that they will not attack your business or property

examples.text: to pay **protection money**
to run a **protection racket**

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin protectio(n-), from protegere ‘cover in front’, from pro- ‘in front’ + tegere ‘to cover’.
